newsitem.title: NIGERIA: Bearish trend, adjustments rule Nigerian stocks.
newsitem.headline: Bearish trend, adjustments rule Nigerian stocks.

text.p: Continued selling of large quantities of shares and adjustment of key stocks dominated the Nigerian stock market on Monday, traders said.
The index rose slightly to 8668.53 from 8666.03 on Friday.
Nestle's adjustment for dividend and scrip also contributed to the downturn, as did conglomerate UAC.
The food company's share, which touched 90 naira on Friday, went ex-dividend and ex-scrip at 42.75 naira on Monday.
Nestle paid shareholders dividend totalling six naira per share and a scrip of one new share for each existing share.
UAC closed 70 kobo down at 17.30 naira ex-dividend.
Union Bank led the sector with a 20 kobo drop to 14.20 naira. Afribank lost the same 20 kobo to end at 8.00 naira while First Bank finished 10 kobo down at 14.40 naira.
But newly listed Guaranty Trust Bank strengthened, adding 15 kobo to 13.10 naira, while a handful of small banks made marginal gains.
Brewer Guinness also fell by 10 kobo to 7.80 naira, the same as West African Portland Cement Company (WAPCO), which closed at 65.30 naira.
Other leading conglomerates were not spared by the bearish mood. PZ Industries PZIN.LG closed at 29.65 naira, down five kobo and Lever Brothers closed at 28.60 naira, losing 10 kobo.
Oil marketer African Petroleum was down five kobo at 57.85 naira while Agip ended 20 kobo weaker at 22.50 naira.
Among the few notable gainers were Texaco, climbing 10 kobo to 49.30 naira, the same as Flour Mills which hit 15.80 naira.
